title: Provincial Court Family Law Act Protection Order

elements.name: POSelectedWarning
elements.title: Please note: You can take in paper work for PO right away without finishing the next series of questions.

elements.name: doYouWantToApply
elements.title: Do you want to apply for a court order about any of the following?
elements.description:
Parenting arrangements how each guardian will parent their child(ren), including each guardians' parenting responsibilities for decision making about a child and the parenting time each guardian spends with a child. Parenting responsibilities may be shared or exercised separately. The only thing you can consider in making your parenting arrangements is what is in the best interest of the child.

Child support is the amount of money a parent or guardian pays to another parent or guardian to help care for the child(ren). A child has the right to be supported by both parents, whether or not the parents ever lived together or the parent has ever lived with the child.

Contact with a child time a child spends with someone who is not their guardian. This person could include a parent who is not a guardian to a child, or other people, like grandparents.

Guardianship who is responsible for a child. Only guardians have parental responsibilities and parenting time with a child. An agreement or order about parenting arrangements can say a child's guardians share parental responsibilities or parenting time, or it can say one guardian is responsible for more of the parenting decisions and has more of the parenting time with the child.

Spousal support money that one spouse pays to another spouse for their financial support after separation. A person is not entitled to spousal support in every case.

elements.name: whatIsParentingArrangement
elements.title:
Parenting arrangements include how each guardian will parent their child(ren), including each guardians' parenting responsibilities for decision making about a child and the parenting time each guardian spends with a child. Parenting responsibilities may be shared or exercised separately. The only thing you can consider in making your parenting arrangements is what is in the best interest of the child.

You can only apply if you are the Guardian or as part of this application you are applying to become a guardian.

elements.title: This series of questions will help you tell the court and the other party what you want the court to order about your existing parenting order or written agreement. Parenting time and parental responsibilities together are known as parenting arrangements. They must be in the best interests of the child. Only a guardian can have parenting time and parental responsibilities.

elements.name: anySpecialExpenses
elements.title: Are you claiming any special or extraordinary expenses?

elements.name: question1
elements.title:
for above question: If yes, display worksheet to complete (note: Same fact sheet A from divorce app), If no, next question.

If this is the only schedule or the last of the schedule the user selected. Go to 'Financial Statement' if required. NOTE: Financial Statements are required if:
Party is the payor (If person selected their own name at Q10)
split or shared parenting time (Q4)
there is a child 19 years old or over for whom support is claimed (Q11)
a party has been acting as a parent to a child of the other party (Q2)
the paying parent earns more than $150,000 per year (Q6 or Q8)
special or extraordinary expenses are being claimed for a child (Q17)
I am claiming undue hardship (Q16)

We should know all these from previous questions. If the party is unable to complete the financial statement, and it is required, they will need to file an application asking for permission to not file it, and indicate it on this schedule.
